tasks.description: Tens numbers chart showing: 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 100. Display numbers with German words: zwanzig, dreißig, vierzig, fünfzig, sechzig, siebzig, achtzig, neunzig, hundert. Highlight dreißig with ß in different color. Show pattern of -zig ending.
tasks.context: Vocabulary: Tens from 20-100, emphasizing -zig pattern and dreißig exception

specs.style: educational chart, pattern recognition, highlight exceptions, systematic layout

tasks.notes: Pattern recognition important - all end in -zig except dreißig (ß)

tasks.description: Compound numbers (21-99) construction diagram. Show formula: 'ONES + und + TENS'. Display examples with visual breakdown: 25 = fünf (5) + und + zwanzig (20) = fünfundzwanzig. 34 = vier (4) + und + dreißig (30) = vierunddreißig. 67 = sieben (7) + und + sechzig (60) = siebenundsechzig. Use arrows or plus signs to show construction. Compare to English/Persian word order to show difference.
tasks.context: Grammar tip: German compound numbers - ones before tens (reverse of English/Persian)

specs.style: educational diagram, formula display, step-by-step construction, comparative linguistics

tasks.notes: CRITICAL concept - German reverses order from English and Persian. Needs very clear explanation.

tasks.description: German number writing conventions infographic. Four sections: 1) Handwritten numbers showing German style (1 with top stroke, 7 with middle stroke) vs other styles. 2) Decimal notation: 5,99€ (comma for decimals). 3) Thousands separator: 1.000 (period for thousands). 4) Date format: 20.12.2024 (day.month.year). Include visual examples and comparison with other formats.
tasks.context: Cultural note: How Germans write numbers, prices, and dates differently

specs.style: infographic, comparative display, practical examples, cultural education

tasks.notes: Important practical information - German conventions differ from English/Persian
